summary: Woodbridge Annual Town Meeting, vote to purchase CCW for $6.9M. *Residents vote overwhelmingly in support – 435 in favor, 34 opposed.*
Toll proposes purchase of 17 acres for $2.3M to build 58 age restricted units. *Vote fails at referendum by 2:1 margin – 1190 opposed, 587 in favor.*

Town issues RFP for development, there are two responses, but one withdraws leaving Toll as the only option. Toll proposes purchasing 100 acres for $7.5M to build 170 age restricted units. *Proposal fails in the face of resident opposition.*

Roland Betts proposes purchasing property for golf use. Residents voice support but First Selectman Scalettar bungles the negotiations, Betts does not get Yale support and the proposal fails. Scalettar says the *Town is going to preserve the land as "true open space".*
Unsolicited proposal from InSite Development to purchase 60 acres for $5.4M to build 120 age restricted units. *Proposal fails in February 2020 in the face of resident opposition.*
Unsolicited proposal from Arbor Haven to purchase 100 acres for $9M for 145 units, 62 of which are age restricted, 83 unrestricted.
